name: Enjoy the Charm of the Real Corsica
description: This round trip offers mountain lovers easy to moderate hikes in a mild Mediterranean climate. Discover the untouched scenery of Corsica’s fascinating rocky landscape crossed by rushing torrents, picturesque creeks and crystal clear natural pools.

dayProgram.title: Ajaccio - Serra-di-Scopamène
dayProgram.description:
Pick Up of your Rental Car at the Airport


At your arrival at the airport a rental car of category N (Renault Scenic) will be at your disposal. Thus, you can move freely and comfortably around the island. On the day of departure you will drop off the vehicle at the airport.


Inclusive: airport charge, insurances (CDW, THF), LAF, without mileage limitation. The charges for optional accessory are to be paid on-site : Additional driver, young driver extra charge - 25 years, GPS, One way.




Suggestion: Drive to Serra-di-Scopamène


You will reach Serra-di-Scopamène after a 2-hour-drive in your rental car. On the way, you will see the pretty village Petreto-Bicchisano right next to the mountain San Petru and the shepherd's village Aullène, embedded in the mountains.




Night and breakfast in a Guesthouse in Casa Sarrinca

﻿
dayProgram.included_list: car rental, insurances (CDW, THF), LAF, without mileage limitation, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Sartène - Serra-di-Scopamène
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion: Take a Tour to the Hinterland and visit the small Town of Sartène


Sartène, “the most Corsican of all Corsican towns“ offers a stunning panoramic view from the Gulf of Valinco to the massif of the Aiguilles de Bavella. Take a stroll through the picturesque narrow alleys and make a stop in one of the manifold shops offering local handcraft and delicatessen. Most shops propose tastings, why not treat yourself?


One of the town's most interesting museums is the “A Casa di Roccapina” offering exhibitions, shows and interactive activities. Audio-guides in English and many other languages will be at your disposal.


Here you will also find prehistoric standing stones such as menhirs and megaliths.




Night and breakfast in a Guesthouse in Casa Sarrinca

﻿

dayProgram.title: Col de Bavella - Serra-di-Scopamène
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion: Mountain Hike through the Regional Natural Park to the "Trou de la Bombe"


Participate in a hike through one of the most fascinating mountain sceneries Corsica has to offer. Via the impressive mountain pass Col de Bavella, you will get right into the heart of the Regional Natural Park. Craggy peaks, mighty cliffs and wind-bent pine trees characterize the landscape.


After a walk through the pinewood of Lariccio, you will reach the “Trou de la Bombe”, a naturally formed hole of 8 m in diameter in the ridge of the Paliri Mountains offering a breathtakingly beautiful view of the massif and the western slope.




Night and breakfast in a Guesthouse in Casa Sarrinca

﻿

dayProgram.title: Cervione - Centuri
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion: Free day in Cervione


Enjoy your Corsica holiday at the beach in Cervione. Within walking distance of your accommodation, you have access to the beautiful beaches. Here you can rest, explore the numerous restaurants and cafes and discover the area.




Night and breakfast in a guesthouse at Cap Corse

﻿

dayProgram.title: Saint-Florent - Centuri
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion: Easy Hike along the Path “Sentier des Douaniers“at Cap Corse


The hiking trail “Sentier des douaniers” will lead on the track of the former customer officers. You will walk past the old Genoese tower Santa Maria, and impressive rocks overhanging the blue sea.


If you want to soak up the pure sea breeze and take in the beautiful scenery, this will be the ideal hike for you!

 



Night and breakfast in a guesthouse at Cap Corse

﻿

dayProgram.title: Bastia - Vivario
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion: visit of Bastia


The dynamic city of Bastia remains lively year-round, and offers a wonderful welcome to Corsica. While it may not have the relaxed charm of its long-term rival Ajaccio, and is home to fewer people, it’s much larger to stroll around, and has the feel of a genuine lived-in city that refuses to sell its soul just to please the tourists.


Bastia’s historic core consists of two distinct neighbourhoods: Terra Vecchia, surrounding the small original harbour; and Terra Nova, the high-walled citadel above. Although those names mean ‘Old Land’ and ‘New Land’, the hilltop fortress is actually much older, built from the 15th century onwards as the stronghold of Bastia’s Genoese overlords. What’s now the Terra Vecchia replaced the tiny fishing village below with a tangle of alleyways, an ensemble of splendidly top-heavy tenement blocks, and some fine churches.


You may want to browse around the abundant colorful markets where cheeses, fish, sea food, cold cuts, honey, olives, wine, and many other regional delicatessen are praised with the typical Corsican loquaciousness.





Night and breakfast in Superior room in a 3*-hotel in Vizzavone

﻿

dayProgram.title: Vivario
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion Mountain Tour to the Cascade des Anglais


Discover a unique glacial valley. After a two-hour walk along an ancient path, formerly used for the seasonal move of sheep and goats, you will reach a magic spot with vestiges of ancient sheep-farms, dozing on the shore of a mountain torrent shaded by a large beech grove – the ideal moment for a break and a refreshing dip in the Cascade!


Once rested, you will continue to the pass Col de Vizzavona via the mythic path GR20. During the whole tour, your guide will attract your attention to the untouched flora and fauna, as well as to the cultural heritage of the region.




Night and breakfast in Superior room in a 3*-hotel in Vizzavone

﻿

dayProgram.title: Ajaccio
dayProgram.description:
Suggestion: visit of Ajaccio, the “Imperial City”


Ajaccio is the capital of Corsica.


The rue Fesch is a pleasant pedestrian street and the city’s main road. You may want to visit the Musée Fesch, a museum of contemporary art which is located in this street. Browse the colorful abundant market, take a stroll through the marina or the picturesque narrow alleys, and immerse yourself in the authentic Corsican "art de vivre"!


The city’s most notorious citizen is Napoleon Bonaparte, who was born there in 1769.


One of the city’s highlights is the Domaine des Milelli. Nestling on the heights of Ajaccio, the property is surrounded by a twelve-hectare century-old olive grove. It is not surprising that Napoleon Bonaparte had chosen this idyllic scenery to set up his country house. Today the property it is a public park offering beautiful strolls. Bonaparte’s country house is heritage-protected and therefore not open for visitors.



End of the trip


Unfortunately, this is already time to leave! You must return your rental car at Ajaccio Airport.
